results.title: The Janet Gardiner Case: Forensic Science at Work
results.brief_description: A dramatised film explaining, through the re-creation of a crime, the concept of forensic science and showing how the Forensic Section of the Police Department operates.

results.title: The Right person for the job
results.brief_description: Excerpts from a seminar held on equal rights legislation held at Trinity College, Melbourne University, are interspersed with dramatisations of problems which women face in the workforce. Shows the role of the conciliation officer and the hearing of a discrimination case by the Equal Opportunity Board

results.title: Damn it. B.Y.O.
results.brief_description: 1. “Damn it” (Sweden, 1980, 20 min.): An animated film showing the physical and emotional stresses experienced by a young man in a big city. 2. “BYO” (Brisbane, 1980, 19 min.): A dramatisation of a school dance where smuggling alcohol causes more trouble than it’s worth.

results.title: Compilation: big brown beastie big brown face
results.brief_description: Big brown beastie, big brown face (Aust., prod., dir. Robert Talbot): Film about Bill Roycroft, world famous Australian horseman. “Ponies of Miklaengi” (U.S., prod. Daniel Smith ; dir. Gary Templeton): Two youngsters on horses round up sheep in Iceland. “So you want to own a pony” (Sydney, prod., dir. Robert Talbot): Explains the role of the Pony Club in helping owners with their first pony.

results.title: Compilation: anyway what is an Australian?
results.brief_description: Anyway…what is an Australian? (Melb., dir. Barbara Boyd; exec. prod. Ross Campbell): Views the concept of multiculturalism through the eyes of several new Australians in Melbourne. “Arrivederci Roma” (Melb., dir. Geoffrey Wright; prod. Richard Zatorski): A new Australian student comes to grips with his first swimming lesson. “Minh: a Vietnamese” (Sydney): A look at the life of a Vietnamese refugee in Australia.

results.title: The Rigid Heddle Frame
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson, John Gray and Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Weaving”.
An instructional film on weaving for both beginners and more advanced weavers. In the rigid heddle frame, warp threads are passed through a slotted, wooden heddle instead of being attached to moving cords. Additional credits: photographer: Alan Grice ; script: Kay Donald ; editor: David Corke ; weaver and adviser: Erika Semler.

results.title: A Safe place
results.creator_credit: Anne Whitehead, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Robyn Cooney
results.brief_description: The prevention of child accidents in the home. Begins in the hospital, with the treatment of children in accidents, then broadens to a general look at the development of children in the first few years of growth, their capabilities, and perception of their environment, and potential for accident situations. Looks at ways of reducing risks to create a safe home environment.

results.title: The Lost 600
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, New South Wales. Dept. of Sport and Recreation and Michael Robertson Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety in, on and near the water”.
Emphasises the dangers associated with foolish, unsafe and reckless behaviour in and on the water. Among the many aspects of water safety covered are still-water drownings, surf safety, boating, yachting, water skiing, rock fishing and home pools.

results.title: Life Minus 3
results.brief_description: A film for the layperson on emergency procedures should someone have a sudden heart attack. If the heart stops beating, brain cells will die after three minutes. During this three minute period it is vital that life be prolonged by heart-lung and mouth to mouth resuscitation until expert aid arrives.
